headline.main: Ship Commonwealth Ashore--The Smuggling on the Canada--Editorial Retirement.

docs.lead_paragraph: The new ship Commonwealth, Captain KNAPP, from Newburyport for New Orleans, went ashore at 5 o'clock this morning, in a fog, on Spit Sand, Newburyport Bar.
docs.snippet: The new ship Commonwealth, Captain KNAPP, from Newburyport for New Orleans, went ashore at 5 o'clock this morning, in a fog, on Spit Sand, Newburyport Bar.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; HAYS DISCHARGED. NOLLE PROSEQUI ENTERED. POISONING CASE. Trial of Andrew Williams for the Murder, of his Wife. COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER. Before Hon. Judge Roosevelt. Murder Trial. New-York Sketch Club. Meeting of the Board of Education. The Twentieth Ward Election Fraud. SUPREME COURT--GENERAL TERM--Wednesday. COURT OF GENERAL SESSIONS-Wednesday. SENTENCES. SUPREME COURT--SPECIAL TERM. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS--Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the opening of the Court yesterday the District Attorney rose and stated that, from the evidence in his possession, and given before the Coroner's Jury, it was apparent that Mr. Hays, at the time Dr. Lutener died, was in Harlem, and therefore that he should now move the Court for leave to enter a nolle prosequi in the case against Mr. Hays.

headline.main: Movements of Ex-President Fillmore.; Visit to the Crystal Palace--Letter from the Young Men's Whig General Committee.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. FILLMORE meets with a high degree of attention during his sojourn among us. He was yesterday called upon by a number of personal friends and strangers, and in the afternoon sat down to a sumptuous dinner at the St. Nicholas, in company with a few friends, members of the Common Council and others. The dinner was entirely private.

headline.main: STATEN ISLAND.; Anniversary of the Society for the Relief of Destitute Children of Seamen.

docs.lead_paragraph: The eighth anniversary of the Society for the Relief of Destitute Children of Seamen took place on Wednesday at the Home for the Children of Seamen, near the Sailor's Snug Harbor, Staten island. A large number of the friends of the institution were present. The room in which the exercises were held was neatly fitted up for the occasion.
docs.snippet: The eighth anniversary of the Society for the Relief of Destitute Children of Seamen took place on Wednesday at the Home for the Children of Seamen, near the Sailor's Snug Harbor, Staten island. A large number of the friends of the institution were...

headline.main: THE "KNOW-NOTHING" EXCITEMENT.; Investigation of the Charges of Burglary. Interesting Proceedings in Court. BEFORE JUSTICE OSBORNE.

docs.lead_paragraph: A great crowd of people assembled yesterday in the old Court of Sessions room at he Tombs, to hear the evidence in the case of burglary charged against Messrs. WILKINSON SLEIGHT, CHARLES B. ALLEN, and BENJAMIN P. MORRIS, who stood charged with burglariously entering the room of Mr. ELLIOT, No. 81 Nassau-street, and taking therefrom a trunk containing property belonging to Mr. ELLIOT.

headline.main: THE WARD TRIAL.; IMPORTANT AND INTERESTING. MR. CRITTENDEN'S SPEECH IN DEFENCE OF WARD. THE JUDGE'S CHARGE. THE VERDICT AND CLOSING SCENES. From the Report made by A. D. Richardson, Esq., for Mr. Ward--Published by the Appletons, Broadway, New-York. CHARGE OF THE COURT. NINTH DAY....THURSDAY, April 27, 1854.

docs.lead_paragraph: New-York is getting close to every part of the South and the Southwest. About twelve hours takes us to Alexandria, Va. If the traveler is on the way to Southwestern Virginia, he can take the Alexandria and Orange Railroad any morning and proceed to Gordonsville.

headline.main: THIRTY-THIRD CONGRESS.....First Session.; SENATE... HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIFES.

docs.lead_paragraph: A few petitions were presented. The bill for the relief of J. W. KELLY, Mail Contractor in Florida, was taken up, and after a debate as to the reason why KELLY'S contract was discontinued, the bill was passed. Mr. SHIELDS reported a bill granting the Fort Huron and Lake Michigan Railroad Company the right of way through the Military reservation at Fort Gratiot, which was taken up and passed.
